channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Votes are being cast as electors meet to affirm Biden's win
Track US electoral college votes state by state
Electoral College voting is underway across the US
Al Gore has a message for those challenging Trump's loss
item.description: Former Vice President and Democratic presidential nominee Al Gore speaks to CNN's Jake Tapper about the 20th anniversary of his concession to President George W. Bush in 2000 and how it compares with President Donald Trump's failure to concede.

item.title: An elite Russian team specializing in toxins stalked Putin's nemesis. Then he was poisoned
CNN investigation uncovers tailing of Navalny prior to poisoning
item.description: CNN joins an investigation by the group Bellingcat that has pieced together how the Russian Security Service followed Russian opposition leader Alexey Navalny and his team throughout a trip to Siberia just prior to his poisoning in August 2020. CNN's Clarissa Ward reports.

item.title: US officials scramble to deal with suspected Russian hack of government agencies
item.description: US officials suspect that Russian-linked hackers were behind the recent data breach of multiple federal agencies, including the Treasury and Commerce Departments, but are continuing to investigate the incident, a senior administration official told CNN Monday.

item.title: At least four stabbed at 'Stop the Steal' election protests in Washington, DC
item.description: At least four people were stabbed Saturday night amid post-election protests in Washington, according to the DC Metropolitan Police Department's public affairs office.

item.title: ICU nurse describes how it feels to get the Covid vaccine
New variant of Covid-19 identified in UK
item.description: A new variant of Covid-19 has been identified in the southeast of England, UK Health Secretary Matt Hancock said Monday, as he announced that London would return to a strict lockdown this week, after coronavirus cases there soared.

item.title: First Covid-19 vaccine given to a NY health care worker
item.description: New York state vaccinated their first health care worker during a livestream organized by Gov. Andrew Cuomo. The Pfizer-BioNTech Covid-19 vaccine was administered to critical care nurse Sandra who shared a message of hope after the injection.

item.title: The UK will let some sexually active gay and bisexual men give blood, ending a controversial ban
item.description: The UK will allow some sexually active gay and bisexual men to donate blood, overturning a ban that originated during the HIV/AIDS epidemic of the 1980s and has been decried as homophobic for years.

item.title: US identifies and sanctions two Iranian intelligence officers for abduction and 'probable death' of Bob Levinson
item.description: The Trump administration on Monday identified and sanctioned two senior Iranian intelligence officials whom the US government says were involved in the abduction and "probable death" of former FBI agent Robert Levinson.

item.title: Google hit with massive outage, including YouTube, Gmail and Google Docs
item.description: Google's services were down Monday in a massive outage that prevented many people from watching YouTube videos, accessing their Google Docs or sending email on Gmail.

item.title: Trump says he halted plan to immediately vaccinate White House staffers
President Trump's first on-camera interview since the election
item.description: In an interview with Fox News, President Trump remained steadfast in his false claims of election fraud.

item.title: More than 300 students still unaccounted for after Nigerian school raid
item.description: Some 337 students are still unaccounted for after gunmen attacked a school in northern Nigeria over the weekend, a government official told CNN on Monday.

item.title: Watch vaccines being unboxed in US
item.description: The United States is beginning its vaccination program as the first coronavirus vaccines arrive at US hospitals. CNN's Sara Murray reports from Washington DC as vaccines are unboxed in Michigan.

item.title: How a former British inmate helped this US basketball player get out of jail in China
item.description: When they brought him his passport, Jeff Harper thought he was getting out.Â

item.title: Singapore oil tanker hit by explosion caused by 'external source' off Saudi Arabia
item.description: A Singapore-flagged oil tanker was hit by "an external source" while discharging at the port of Jeddah in Saudi Arabia Monday, owner and operator Hafnia said in a statement.

item.title: What today's Electoral College vote really means
item.description: CNN's John Avlon looks at the history of the US Electoral College, as members of the Electoral College plan to ratify their respective states' votes and determine the winner of the 2020 election.

item.title: Meghan makes surprise appearance on CNN
item.description: Meghan, Duchess of Sussex, made an unscheduled appearance on CNN's annual Heroes TV special Sunday to honor the year's most inspiring moments and the people who made them happen.

item.title: NASA releases never-before-seen images from Hubble Telescope
item.description: In honor of the Hubble Space Telescope turning 30 this year, NASA and its partners have released never-before-seen images from its three-decade-long career.

item.title: Serena Williams: It's time for Silicon Valley to take Black women entrepreneurs seriously
item.description: My life story is one of breaking barriers and championing inclusion, on and off the court. Coming up in a predominately White male sport, I have been underestimated and underpaid throughout my career. Now, as a venture capitalist investing in early-stage startups, I see myself in the Black female founders who are often counted out right from the start.

item.title: Reddit is buying TikTok rival Dubsmash
item.description: Message board juggernaut Reddit is accelerating its push into video, snapping up a sharing platform that is popular with young people and women.

item.title: His rivals have been arrested or exiled, but Ivorian President insists: 'They're not democrats'
item.description: On November 9, a group of men gathered in a dusty town in southern Ivory Coast that sits at the junction of two major highways. The group walked onto the road to block traffic to protest the re-election of Ivorian President Alassane Ouattara.

item.title: The real cost of being the ultimate Apple fan: Nearly $80,000
item.description: Picture this: You are the ultimate Apple fan. You've got an unlimited budget. And you want all of the things: top-of-the-line devices, fancy accessories and services.

item.title: Analyst discusses Russian misinformation around Covid-19 vaccine
item.description: CNN national security analyst Samantha Vinograd discusses the risks of disinformation around the coronavirus vaccine and warns Americans to be on "high alert."

item.title: Scientists digitally rebuilt this dinosaur's brain and made some surprising discoveries
item.description: Scientists have digitally rebuilt the brain of a dinosaur, revealing "surprising" insights into its diet and behavior.

item.title: California has appointed its first ever Muslim chaplain to the state legislature
item.description: A Muslim man has made history after becoming the first Muslim chaplain appointed to the California Legislature.

item.title: Bill Gates warns next 4 to 6 months could be worst of the pandemic
item.description: Bill Gates talks with CNN's Jake Tapper about the US response to the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Best-selling spy novelist John le CarrÃ© dies at 89
item.description: Best-selling British espionage writer David Cornwell -- known to the world as John le CarrÃ© -- died Saturday at 89, according to his literary agent.

item.title: Burger King's India franchise soars 125% on stock market debut
item.description: Burger King's Indian franchise has pulled off a whopper initial public offering.

item.title: Hear what organizer of protest said to a CNN reporter
item.description: Conspiracy theories and misinformation about the election are being used to raise money from Trump supporters. Websites supporting "Stop the Steal" ask for cash, and since election day the Trump campaign and other related groups have pulled in hundreds of millions of dollars. CNN's Drew Griffin reports.

item.title: UK and EU agree to keep talking past deadline as 'no-deal Brexit' looms large
item.description: The United Kingdom and the European Union have agreed -- once again -- to extend trade talks beyond a self-imposed deadline after failing to reach a compromise, European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen said on Sunday.

item.title: What's gone wrong at Scuderia Ferrari?
item.description: With 13th and 14th placed finishes in Sunday's Abu Dhabi Grand Prix, Scuderia Ferrari recorded its worst season since 1980. It has been a disastrous year.

item.title: How Europe's night trains came back from the dead
item.description: Going to bed in one major city and waking up in another; toasting the landscape as a new country slips past; being rocked to sleep as you rattle across a continent. It's no wonder that the night trains of Europe have been a byword for romance, immortalized by writers such as Agatha Christie.

item.title: Archaeologists reveal new section of Aztec skull tower
item.description: Archaeologists have uncovered 119 more human skulls on a famous Aztec tzompantli in Mexico City.

item.title: 2023 Rugby World Cup draw confirmed as New Zealand face host France in pool stage
item.description: Three-time winner New Zealand will face host France at the 2023 Rugby World Cup after the pool stage draw was made on Monday.

item.title: Budget Christmas 101: Pandemic hardships don't mean the holidays are canceled
item.description: The holidays are often a time when the goal of saving money is in opposition with showing people love in the grandest of ways.

item.title: PSG faces anxious wait on Neymar injury after Brazilian star stretchered off in defeat by Lyon
item.description: Paris Saint-Germain is waiting to find out the severity of an injury to Neymar after the Brazilian star was stretchered off in the Ligue 1 game against Lyon.

item.title: GÃ©rard Houllier, former Liverpool and France manager, dies aged 73
item.description: Former Liverpool and France manager GÃ©rard Houllier has died aged 73, according to the English Premier League club.

item.title: You can now get Scotch whisky KitKats -- but only in Japan
item.description: NestlÃ© has launched an elaborate new line of KitKats in Japan, using chocolate aged for six months in whisky barrels in Scotland.

item.title: Holiday gift guide: Ethical luxuries for conscientious shoppers
item.description: For many of us, the holidays will look a little different this year. There may be no big family gatherings to plan, or office parties to go to. We probably won't be holidaying anywhere exotic. We may also be spending less.

item.title: Organizers apologize after videos show packed crowds at Mexican art festival
item.description: The five-day Art With Me festival drew hundreds of attendees in mid-November. The organizers have apologized after images and video posted on social media revealed packed crowds of people without masks in Mexico's hipster resort town of Tulum. CNN's Matt Rivers reports.

item.title: The 538 electors who make up the Electoral College are gathering today to formally cast their votes for president
item.description: â¢ A step-by-step guide to Monday's Electoral College vote â¢ Trump raised firing Barr in White House meeting

item.title: Electoral College voting begins across the US
item.description: State electors are casting their ballots for president Monday, opening the formal Electoral College process of sealing Joe Biden's election as the 46th president of the United States.

item.title: What faithless electors are and why they won't matter this year
item.description: With President Donald Trump's subversion efforts suffering blow after blow, some of his allies have looked to the Electoral College and the prospect of so-called "faithless electors" as a potential avenue for keeping the President in power.

item.title: Analysis: The one good thing Trump's assault on democracy has done for America
item.description: President Donald Trump's fact-free assault on the 2020 vote, which will continue even after the Electoral College affirms on Monday that he lost and President-elect Joe Bide won, has been terrible in a variety of ways for American democracy.

item.title: Opinion: Donald Trump's long goodbye
item.description: Minutes after he took the oath of office as the 45th President of the United States at the US Capitol on January 20, 2017, Donald Trump expressed gratitude to the outgoing President and first lady.
